page.title: 02Norton's retirement scheme.
page.content: Norton Hall Farm used to be a large farm.The Letchworth Garden City Corp. bought it and turned it into a private living area for senior citizens.There are three flats in the large building.One single bungalow costs Â£44,000 and a double one Â£45,000.It has been running for six months.One person has got a dog.Mr. Bamba is the oldest person.The first person to move in was Mr. Bragg.There is one couple. There are seven people at the moment.Half the farm is 100 years old and the other part is 200 years old.There is a communal room where they all get together for coffee mornings and social occasions.The whole complex is run by a warden who sees to everybodies needs.The Norton Hall Farm Retirement Homes were opened by Baroness Evelyn Denington in June of this year.
